author: Tehelka Web Desk
title: Flipkart kicks off ‘Big Billion Days’ sale
text:
Comment Flipkart ’s Big Billion Days sale starts 
India ’s leading e-retailing site, Flipkart .com, has started its much awaited “Big Billion Days” sale unlocking its fashion sale today, October 13, 2015. The sale of fashion which started today embarks the 5 day long sale. 
The second edition of “Big Billion Sale” is being held between 13th and 17th October, 2015, which starts midnight. Giving emphasis on app, this mega-sale will be a five day-long app-only shopping event for customers to avail exciting offers and unbeatable discounts across 70+ product categories.’ 
Sale category as per date: 
13th – 17th October: Fashion (Unlocked) 
14th – 17th October: Home & Appliances (Locked) 
15th – 17th October: Mobile & Accessories (Locked) 
16th – 17th October: Electronics & Automotive (Locked) 
17th October: Books (Locked) 
Apart from its sale on products, the e-retailing giants is also giving a 10% cash back to its customers who will use select debit and credit cards. City Bank, Yes bank, and Standard Chartered debit and credit cards can avail this additional benefit on shopping with their cards during these date – 
13th – 14th October : SBI 
15th October : Citi Bank, Yes Bank and Standard Chartered 
16th – 17th October : SBI 
In a statement which was released recently, Flipkart said,”As an app-only shopping event, our ‘big billion days’ have exciting offers and discounts across 70 product categories for customers,” Flipkart said in a statement here. 
Unlike last year when the sale was for a day (October 6) through its portal, which the company claimed had a billion hits, the special sale which starts today last for five days to celebrate the ensuing festive season. 
“The sale will be special to shop for gifts and other items. Customers can shop for apparels, footwear, mobiles, furniture, laptops, toys, large appliances, jewellery, watches or home furnishing items,” Flipkart ’s commerce platform head Mukesh Bansal said in the statement. 
Fashion portal Myntra , in which Flipkart bought majority stake for an estimated Rs.2,000 crore in May 2014, is also taking part of the special sale with a selection from iconic brands at special offers. 
“ India shops the most during this time of the year. With 75 per cent of traffic coming via mobile, we expect this ‘app only’ sale to be the biggest shopping event of the year,” Bansal, who is also Myntra ’s chairman, added. 
Flipkart claims to offer about 30 million products across 70 categories, including books, media, consumer electronics and lifestyle. 
“We have also ramped up our technology and supply chain support to ensure all our 50 million customers have the best ever mobile shopping experience. Infact, to cater to the massive customer demand; we have opened new fulfillment centers across the country to guarantee efficient delivery”, Bansal added. 
With 50-million registered users and 33,000 employees, the Flipkart portal gets about 10 million hits daily and delivers eight million shipments per month.
